title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 November 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Guest3187> has quit  
00:23 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
00:23 <cjd> is now known as <Guest1255>  
00:32 <Guest1255> has quit  
00:42 <abusenius> has quit  
00:45 <vmassol> has quit  
01:22 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:47 <vmassol> has quit  
02:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
03:22 <vmassol> has quit  
04:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
04:09 <vmassol> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
05:11 <vmassol> has quit  
06:01 <Denis> has quit  
06:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
06:11 <vmassol> has quit  
07:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:08 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
07:08 <cjd> is now known as <Guest40785>  
07:12 <vmassol> has quit  
07:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <Guest40785> has quit  
08:04 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <vmassol> good morning  
09:08 <vmassol> seems we have lots of issues with our sonar platform job: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/  
09:08 <vmassol> not sure why  
09:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: the log seems to indicate that all is ok in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/122/  
09:15 <tmortagne> not sure how jenkins found a "VNC connection issue!"  
09:16 <vmassol> let me check thét  
09:16 <vmassol> that  
09:17 <tmortagne> I did not real the whole log since it's just uge  
09:17 <tmortagne> read  
09:17 <vmassol> onVerbatim [java.lang.InternalError: Can't connect to X11 window server using ':78' as the value of the DISPLAY variable.  
09:17 <tmortagne> yes but there is no failing test listed and the build is a success  
09:18 <vmassol> sure but that's not how it works  
09:18 <vmassol> our email ext plugin will check the build for some regex and fail it and not send email on that  
09:18 <vmassol> in this case the formula renderer failed  
09:19 <vmassol> and sent a verbatim block with the exaception  
09:19 <vmassol> but the test isn't checking it  
09:19 <vmassol> which is why it still passed  
09:19 <vmassol> but it doesn't make it right :)  
09:19 <vmassol> it means something is wrong in the env setup  
09:19 <vmassol> btw  
09:20 <vmassol> I see a test failure  
09:20 <vmassol> it says  
09:20 <vmassol> Tests run: 2, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0  
09:20 <vmassol> [ERROR] There are test failures  
09:20 <vmassol> so there was a test failure  
09:20 <tmortagne> then it's weird jenkins report them  
09:20 <vmassol> jenkins ignore test failure for build successes but reports them after  
09:20 <tmortagne> \*does not  
09:21 <vmassol> yes strange  
09:21 <vmassol> maybe it happens after the mail ext plugin kicks in  
09:21 <vmassol> and it didn't reach it  
09:21 <tmortagne> I think it's because there is several build in there  
09:21 <tmortagne> jenkins probably parse the last one  
09:22 <tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/lastBuild/testReport/ is far from containing the whole platform  
09:23 <vmassol> yes but that's because they didn't run  
09:24 <vmassol> you can see it on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/lastBuild/  
09:24 <vmassol> it failed before the other modules could be built  
09:24 <vmassol> (stopped at JPQL parser)  
09:24 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-query-jpql-parser/console  
09:24 <tmortagne> how do you get a test failure for a module that was not built ?  
09:24 <vmassol> you don't  
09:25 <vmassol> where do you see that?  
09:25 <tmortagne> (09:20:00 AM) vmassol: I see a test failure  
09:25 <vmassol> you're mixinf build 122 and the latest build  
09:25 <vmassol> \*mixing  
09:25 <vmassol> latest is 123  
09:25 <vmassol> the one you gave me a url for was 122  
09:26 <vmassol> so in 122 there was a test failure while in 123 the problem was a jvm crash  
09:26 <tmortagne> there is no fail in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/122/testReport/ either  
09:26 <vmassol> that's what I said :)  
09:27 <vmassol> in any case the pb in 122 is the display issue  
09:27 <tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/122/testReport/ is missing modules too  
09:28 <vmassol> yes it's missing a few  
09:28 <tmortagne> restarted a full build  
09:28 <vmassol> my worry is the history of this job  
09:28 <tmortagne> the partial build feature of jenkins often have issue...  
09:28 <vmassol> it keeps having issues all the time  
09:29 <vmassol> and I don't know why  
09:29 <vmassol> VNC shouldn't happen for ex  
09:29 <vmassol> since it's started at the beginning of the builf  
09:29 <vmassol> \*build  
09:29 <tmortagne> maybe it crashed during the build  
09:29 <vmassol> yes but that's a lot of unluck seen the history  
09:30 <tmortagne> memory issue or something like this maybe, we would need the vnc log if any  
09:30 <vmassol> on the past 30 runs or so, more than 80% of failures were because of VNC issues  
09:30 <vmassol> we have vnc logs I think  
09:30 <tmortagne> see if it really started and the beginning and properly stopped at the end  
09:32 <vmassol> they're all 831 bytes  
09:33 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/b4206e82ebea82fe3fc9  
09:34 <vmassol> the same logs are on a1 for ex  
09:48 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning, we need to decide if we release now. I pointed out several issues with GD code on Friday. I think the major issues are fixed and those that remain could be fixed for RC1, WDYT?  
09:51 <vmassol> sburjan: how well did you test M2 so far?  
09:51 <sburjan> vmassol: I tested the fixed issues for SOLR and Subwikis  
09:51 <sburjan> which were in the roadmap for 5.3  
09:53 <mflorea> I haven't reviewed GD's pull requests and I haven't followed the dev on wiki manager so I can't tell if the current work on wiki manager is good enough. I'm ready to release as soon as CI is stable and no jobs are running. I see platform is currently building so this means I have to wait a few hours more..  
09:56 <vmassol> mflorea: let's plan a release after lunch for you, ok?  
09:56 <mflorea> sure, but pause the commits :)  
09:57 <mflorea> I'll start preparing the translations  
09:57 <vmassol> ok  
10:00 <tmortagne> mflorea: make sure to pull dev-tools before  
10:00 <mflorea> ok  
10:00 <tmortagne> (removed workspaces and wikimanager from translations script)  
10:00 <mflorea> great, thanks  
10:02 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <vmassol> hmm my platform build keeps failing  
10:24 <vmassol> LuceneAnalyzerTest.searchWithGermanAnalyzer:209 ? NullPointer  
10:24 <vmassol> java.lang.NullPointerException  
10:24 <vmassol> at com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.lucene.LucenePlugin.search(LucenePlugin.java:392)  
10:25 <vmassol> ah passed this time on the 3rd try  
10:25 <vmassol> some race condition I believe  
10:25 <sburjan> vmassol: any plan to release 5.2.2 this week ?  
10:25 <vmassol> no plan ATM  
10:32 <vmassol> maybe next week if we get more issues resolved, unless there's an urgent need of course  
10:33 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <vmassol> testing wiki features again on master (built from sources)  
10:40 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: hi  
10:40 <gdelhumeau> hi vmassol  
10:41 <vmassol> found some new issue  
10:41 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/842c3d31-8bc8-4e45-b7fe-2c1f50e02b4f/f5ac752790e25ab8709742f2dee59dab  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> when does it appear?  
10:41 <vmassol> (the wiki menu's Delete action is also missing the icon)  
10:41 <vmassol> I created a new wiki  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> when you cancel the DW?  
10:41 <vmassol> but since I'm on a snapshot I skipped the DW  
10:42 <vmassol> (I didn't have the snapshot repo in my config)  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> ok, it's because WikiManager.Style does not apply  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> since it is not installed  
10:42 <vmassol> well there's a problem  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> But I have an other problem with WiliManager.Style  
10:43 <vmassol> either it's a vm or it's not  
10:43 <vmassol> it cannot be mixed  
10:43 <gdelhumeau> the visibility is "current wiki", but if the user does not have the PR, it doesnt work  
10:43 <vmassol> right now you have code in vm that requires a page to work  
10:43 <vmassol> that's not nice  
10:43 <gdelhumeau> yes  
10:43 <gdelhumeau> then I can create a .css on the filesystem  
10:43 <gdelhumeau> would be better indeed  
10:43 <vmassol> so either it's a vm feature (ie it works without pages)  
10:43 <vmassol> or it's an app  
10:44 <vmassol> (ie all in pages with extension points)  
10:44 <vmassol> the direction we want to go is ore towards apps IMO  
10:44 <gdelhumeau> it would mean add a lot of extension points  
10:44 <vmassol> ie minimum in vm (and possibly nothing in some future)  
10:44 <vmassol> and features in apps  
10:45 <vmassol> yes we do need a lot of extension points  
10:45 <vmassol> we need that to make xwiki a platform anyway  
10:45 <vmassol> (ludovic has been asking for this too for some time now btw)  
10:45 <vmassol> when you want to customize xwiki it's the only clean way  
10:46 <vmassol> (otherwise you need to modify vms and merge them at any upgrade)  
10:46 <vmassol> (which is a major pita)  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> what should I do for RC1 .  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> ?  
10:49 <vmassol> for RC1 it's simple  
10:49 <vmassol> you do as we already do  
10:49 <vmassol> ie never break a feature :)  
10:49 <vmassol> ie don't display the menu entries if the pages required are missing  
10:49 <vmassol> or  
10:50 <vmassol> move the required resource to the FS temporarily with the plan to move them out later on after you/we add the extension points  
10:50 <vmassol> I don't know  
10:50 <vmassol> what are required from the pages  
10:50 <vmassol> if it's just style  
10:50 <vmassol> then you should move the resources to the FS probably  
10:50 <vmassol> if it's more and the feature cannot work without pages then don't display the menu entries  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> ok  
10:51 <tmortagne> mflorea: it's a small and not dangerous commit, promise  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> ^^  
10:52 <vmassol> :)  
10:52 <tmortagne> evalica: Hi  
10:53 <mflorea> tmortagne: ok, np, but I'll have to wait for the CI builds to pass before starting.  
10:53 <tmortagne> there is no test for what I committed but ok  
10:55 <tmortagne> vmassol: any idea if it's expected that design wiki is forbidden for anyone but admins ?  
10:56 <tmortagne> http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Rights#|t=usersandgroupstable&p=1&l=10&uorg=groups&clsname=XWiki.XWikiGlobalRights&wiki=local  
10:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: no it shouldn't, evalica should know about this  
10:56 <vmassol> evalica: ?  
10:56 <tmortagne> opening it for now since it's open to guests  
10:57 <vmassol> guest must not be able to register there  
10:57 <vmassol> same as for other subwikis  
10:57 <vmassol> could you check it's correctly set?  
10:58 <tmortagne> guest has the default rights so it's able to register but I'm prety sure regsiter link end up in main wiki  
10:58 <tmortagne> like in other wikis  
10:59 <tmortagne> my concern was more for view right  
11:07 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: found another bug  
11:07 <vmassol> more important  
11:07 <vmassol> I created a template wiki  
11:07 <vmassol> (using DW)  
11:07 <vmassol> then I created a new wiki using that template  
11:08 <vmassol> after clicking Finalize I get a wiki with no panels on the right  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> the templates has the panels?  
11:08 <vmassol> yes  
11:08 <vmassol> and indded in XWikiPreferences it says no panels either on left or right  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> it means XWikiPreferences is not wopied then  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> \*copied  
11:30 <evalica> tmortagne: thanks for fixing it. don't know why they were like that, don't remember putting them on purpose  
11:33 <tmortagne> evalica: looks like "code" class is broken in the xwiki.org skin  
11:33 <evalica> code class?  
11:34 <tmortagne> it's supposed to behave like <pre> regarding white spaces and newlines  
11:34 <tmortagne> the css class named "code"  
11:34 <tmortagne> used in the code macro  
11:34 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: when I deleted my template wiki I got in the console: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7525749 This doesn't look right  
11:35 <tmortagne> evalica: jeremie reported it on the list  
11:35 <evalica> tmortagne: where do you see it broken? Also we should have view rights for Unregistered users too, right?  
11:35 <evalica> k - I'll see  
11:36 <tmortagne> evalica: design wiki has the exact same rights as the other wikis now  
11:37 <evalica> tmortagne: well if you are not loggin you cannot see the content … so not sure what is different  
11:37 <tmortagne> evalica: works well for me  
11:37 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
11:38 <tmortagne> it was working and it's the same rights for sure  
11:39 <tmortagne> the view right is not explicitely set on design wiki for anyone  
11:39 <tmortagne> so everyone should have it  
11:39 <tmortagne> same as other wikis  
11:40 <tmortagne> sounds like rights cache bug  
11:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <tmortagne> Denis: any idea why guest cannot see http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/SignedScripts page for example ?  
11:42 <tmortagne> view right is not set at space or wiki level for anyone  
11:42 <evalica> tmortagne:  one of the difference is that design doesn't have an XWikiAllGroup  
11:42 <tmortagne> same as in other wikis  
11:42 <tmortagne> evalica: I know but this should not have any impact here  
11:42 <tmortagne> especially since we don't use that group  
11:43 <tmortagne> but enabled vistual XWikiAllGroup on xwiki.org  
11:43 <tmortagne> so it's useless on all wikis  
11:47 <evalica> I've added the class - but since the page is locked I will not remove the 'defaut' rights. Apparently after I added the object XWikiAllGroups has some rights set  
11:47 <tmortagne> Denis, evalica: looks like the issue was hidden rights  
11:47 <tmortagne> the usual issue with the right UI not listing users/groups that don't  exist  
11:47 <evalica> yep - but that doesn't mean that they are not set  
11:48 <evalica> I will report it on jira  
11:49 <tmortagne> it's ok now  
11:50 <evalica> tmortagne: thank you  
12:19 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: this PR is a very small bugfix request by vmassol  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> \*requested  
12:28 <mflorea> ok  
12:30 <lucaa> has quit  
12:30 <vmassol> applied  
12:31 <vmassol> it's not requested by me, it's an important regression :)  
12:31 <vmassol> I just helped in testing it  
12:31 <vmassol> and I'm glad I did because I 'm finding lots of issue in just a few minutes of testing  
12:31 <camil7> has quit  
12:31 <vmassol> this is worrying btw  
12:31 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: it means you didn't test enough  
12:32 <vmassol> I only did very basic tests  
12:32 <gdelhumeau> I did not focus on the panels...  
13:16 <sburjan> cjd: ping  
13:19 <Kais3n> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <cjd> pong  
13:20 <cjd> sburjan: ^  
13:20 <Kais3n> Hello  
13:20 <cjd> hi  
13:20 <sburjan> cjd,: this doesn't seem to work anymore on a 5.2.1, for some reason: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+TableEdit  
13:20 <mflorea> has quit  
13:21 <cjd> yeah, there's a bug on this :|  
13:21 <cjd> it's complicated  
13:21 <cjd> I'm really tempted to replace the whole piece of code with WebViewer backed code  
13:21 <cjd> it will remove like 90% of the code  
13:22 <Kais3n> Can someone help me out with rights managment with sub wikis?  
13:23 <cjd> Kais3n: just go ahead and ask your question, if someone who is skilled in that section of the code is around, they will answer  
13:27 <Kais3n> Ok I have the main wiki (XWiki) running and "well" configured. So rights managment works fine for that regarding Spaces and Pages.  
13:27 <Kais3n> I now created my first subwiki to see how that works. So I started and selected that just admin should be able to access and join member  
13:28 <Kais3n> but now all member can access  
13:31 <sburjan> cjd: okay, I just wanted to make you aware of it  that's all  
13:31 <evalica> Kais3n: what version?  
13:36 <Kais3n> 5.2.1  
13:38 <Kais3n> As I understood I could give users from the xwiki wiki access but as standard the should not have access.  
13:38 <Kais3n> Or I could add other users which are not know of the xwiki and only they have access but only to the subwiki  
13:40 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: where's the documentation for the Add > Wiki feature?  
13:40 <vmassol> (so that we can point Kais3n to it and if it's not there we need to add it ASAP)  
13:41 <vmassol> actually I don't see it listed on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
13:41 <vmassol> there's Page, Spaces but not Wiki  
13:47 <vmassol> Kais3n: did you see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application  
13:47 <vmassol> ?  
13:47 <vmassol> what option did you choose when creating a wiki, the default is "open for any user to join"  
13:47 <vmassol> ?  
13:47 <vmassol> (slide 3 in the image gallery on that page)  
13:50 <sburjan> vmassol: I think it's funny that we have extensions which depend on certain plugin, and the plugin is installable with EM, but you still have to edit xwiki.cfg to enable the plugin  
13:50 <sburjan> I'd call that user confusion  
13:51 <Kais3n> I Choose the last one that only a admin can invite users  
13:51 <vmassol> Kais3n: ok, checking locally, gdelhumeau is the one who coded this feature and should know better  
13:53 <Kais3n> Ok so I wait until he is online?  
13:54 <vmassol> indeed, I can reproduce, Iet's ask him when he's back  
13:54 <Kais3n> Ok thanks in advanced for that fast answer  
13:54 <vmassol> this is a new feature in 5.2 so we're still stabilizing it  
13:55 <Kais3n> No Problem, I'm "glad" that this is not related to me as I'm a bloody beginer for XWiki  
13:56 <vmassol> :)  
13:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <sburjan> tmortagne: ping. Hello. Is there any way that installing a plugin using EM (I am talking about the Excel Plugin) might not be put in the classpath ? I have followed the instructions, but I get a class not found. My plugin jar is in data/extensions, not in /lib  
14:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: the plugin manager is only looking at root classloader so no you can't install a plugin with Extension Manager  
14:03 <sburjan> well the UI says and does otherwise  
14:03 <sburjan> because It sees it as a dependency and installs it.  
14:03 <sburjan> but good to know  
14:03 <tmortagne> it install it as a jar  
14:03 <tmortagne> that's all EM knows about it  
14:03 <tmortagne> there is no real way for EM to know it's a plugin  
14:04 <sburjan> yes. but if xwiki doesn't look in data/repository then it's useless  
14:04 <tmortagne> sure but it has nothing to do with EM  
14:04 <tmortagne> the issue is on plugin manager side  
14:05 <sburjan> so what is the issue ? the plugin manager is not loogink for jars in data/repository ?  
14:05 <gdelhumeau> the "add wiki" features does the same thing that the old Workspaces Application  
14:05 <tmortagne> sburjan: plugin manager is not supposed to look at jars at all  
14:05 <sburjan> I am asking because I want to add a warning bot on the Excel Plugin page so users knopw this small but important piece of information  
14:05 <tmortagne> it needs to get the current classloader and look there  
14:06 <sburjan> ok. and data/repository is not in the default classloader  
14:06 <tmortagne> but then the plugin manager is not really multiwiki right now  
14:06 <tmortagne> so it would also require a refactoring to support that  
14:06 <sburjan> thanks.  
15:04 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: in http://main.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki53M2#HMulti-Wiki-1 the ending "that now manages how (sub)wikis." seems incomplete.  
15:05 <Kais3n> Maybe one other silly question. I see that you are using JIRA for bugtracking. We are searching beside a WIKI also for a Bugtracking Software. What was you intend to use JIRA?  
15:11 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: ping  
15:11 <gdelhumeau> Can you give me 10min?  
15:12 <sburjan> yes  
15:12 <evalica> tmortagne: regarding rights on design.xwiki.org not sure why registered users don't have edit rights. I tried to give them explictly but still didn't work - do you have any idea?  
15:14 <tmortagne> evalica: on which page did you tested ?  
15:15 <evalica> MailArchive with a 'normal' user (risherry)  
15:15 <evalica> also reported on mail by jeremy  
15:15 <tmortagne> evalica: I see you gave edit right to "XWikiCommittersGroup" groups not to "XWikiAllGroup"  
15:16 <tmortagne> usually when setting right at wiki level does not have any effect it means there is right set at space or document level  
15:16 <evalica> tmortagne: fixed - thanks - I didn't do anything - not sure why those rights are there - maybe when the wiki was created  
15:17 <tmortagne> evalica: cleaned thoses rights this morning it was not there
